paragraphs.text: We can't breathe: Obama's last chance for change.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: No one in the United States is actually surprised that a grand jury in New York City decided not to indict Daniel Pantaleo for the death of Eric Garner
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the same way that few Americans, regardless of political leanings were surprised when Officer Darren Wilson was not indicted for killing Michael Brown in Ferguson, Missouri, just over a week ago
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The proximity of these two rulings, and the subsequent protests and civil unrest that have occurred in their wake, however, is an opportunity for President Barack Obama to make lasting and significant changes in the fundamental principles governing the US
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The question will be does he have the political capital to do it?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Garner was killed in July during what was an unpleasant. but fairly typical interaction between minorities and police in the US
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He was accused by local police of selling "loosies" or cigarettes in boxes that hadn't been properly taxed
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: when he told the officers that he wasn't selling them and was tired of being harassed
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: the situation turned grim
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He was quickly surrounded by several officers
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Officer Pantaleo put Garner in a chokehold and helped force him down onto the ground
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Garner screamed that he couldn't breathe
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: despite his protests police continued to hold his neck in order to handcuff him
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: when it became apparent that he had stopped breathing
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: the four EMTs on the scene made no effort to revive him
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This entire episode was caught on video by a friend of Garner's
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: its viral spread helped spur New York authorities to actually convene a grand jury of 25 New York citizens
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The grand jury, however, decided that despite the visual evidence, and despite the city coroner declaring Garner's death a homicide, that there was not enough evidence to warrant a full trial
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Thousands of Americans of all ages and colours took to the streets in a series of spontaneous protests across the country
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: It's easy from the outside to look at these protests and assume that this is a dangerous and destabilising tipping point; that there is a new wave of violence against minorities that has finally reached a point of no return
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is not entirely true
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Violence against minorities, either directly sanctioned by, or tacitly tolerated by the federal government is the norm in the US, not an anomaly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: From slavery to the massacre of Native Americans to rampant racial terrorism against African Americans, the US has not stopped its bloody relationship with violence and people of colour
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While African Americans only make up 13 percent of the population
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: they account for over 30 percent of all police killings in 2012 alone
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: When you combine this kind of history with racial discrimination in sentencing, arrests, fines, jail time
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: where African Americans routinely receive longer, harsher and less lenient penalties than whites for the same crimes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it is hard to simply say that the cases of Eric Garner (or Michael Brown, or Tamir Rice or John Crawford) are new or isolated incidents
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The US criminal justice system isn't broken
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it's working exactly the way it was intended to work
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it was never written, implemented or designed to provide justice or equality for African Americans
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: However
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what is different in this case is that it's not just African Americans protesting
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: a significant number of white, Latino and Asian Americans have flooded the streets of New York protesting the Garner ruling, shutting down major highways, malls and even disrupting the annual Christmas tree lighting
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: At its core, police violence is a white American problem, not a black one
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The only way this tide of violence can be stemmed is if white Americans who are angry about and stand against institutional racism and discrimination, are willing to directly confront white Americans who still support the way these institutions are run
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Solutions to institutional racism and police violence can't be dropped off at the doors of African Americans any longer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the white American majority must take some responsibility
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Beyond that, it is time for the president to take bolder steps to address systematic inequality in sentencing and policing across the US
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: President Obama has always been partial to piecemeal strategies
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: his rhetoric is often bold and sweeping
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the hostility of the Republican Congress, mixed with his own political personality, has often led to marginal policy changes
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On Monday, he convened a commission of civil rights leaders and unveiled plans to put more shoulder cameras on police officers' uniforms and thoroughly review Programme 1033
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which allows local police departments to get free access to surplus military equipment
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: while those are fine first steps
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: neither would have saved Garner's life or changed the decision of the grand jury
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The police did not have heavy militarised equipment
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they employed a physical chokehold method that had been declared illegal by the New York police department for over 20 years
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: that too wasn't enough to warrant a trial
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While shoulder cameras are known to limit cases of abuse and harassment
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: the Garner case shows that they do not guarantee the police will be held accountable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The only way that the president can do something about these events and the frustration felt by the public is to actually demand that the Department of Justice indict and conduct trials in some of these cases
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: President Obama has no trouble prosecuting "terrorists" and "whistle blowers" or those deemed to have spied on the US
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He could certainly bring the power of the federal government to investigate and indict cases of police violence
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: President Obama is not all powerful
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he is certainly much more capable than he has shown thus far in acting on the issues he feels are priorities for the US
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Obama truly wants to establish a legacy beyond immigration and Obamacare
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: he needs to make large spectacular displays of investigating and indicting officers who engage in misconduct, especially in cases that result in the death of unarmed African Americans
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he doesn't
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the worst part of his final two years as president won't just come from the Republican House and Senate, but from millions of Americans, most of whom voted for him, marching through the streets having lost faith in his ability to lead
paragraphs.label: assumption
